Published October 13, 2019

A Bluetooth headset helps you make hands-free calls and listen to audio
devices while your eyes remain glued to the road. It can also be used at home
or outdoors if you want to keep your hands free while working in the garage or
camping outdoors. We have researched some of the best Bluetooth earpieces on
the market that will help you avoid touching your smartphone while you drive.

## Best Bluetooth Headset Reviews & Recommendations 2020

The Plantronics Voyager is a wireless Bluetooth 3.0 headset with triple mic
technology that reduces background noise to deliver enhanced sound clarity.
It’s also designed with smart sensor technology, which can detect when the
earpiece is on your ear and automatically answer calls. It redirects the calls
to your phone once you put the headset down. The device also features voice-
recognition technology, and you only have to say “answer” or “ignore” to
receive or reject phone calls without touching your phone.

  

The headset is coated with P2i Nano-coating technology to protect the device
from rain, sweat, moisture, and drinks spilled in your car. It takes only 90
minutes to acquire a full charge and will offer up to seven hours of talk
time. Generally, the device feels comfortable in your ear and is durable. It’s
also compatible with Android apps and other Bluetooth 4.0 headsets.

  

However, a major problem you may experience with this device over time is that
it may disconnect calls unexpectedly. The smart sensor may develop issues and
disconnect the call with minimal body movement. Also, the incoming volume may
be too loud, and you may also have to reboot it a couple of times if you leave
it discharged for a long time.

Best Value

[Check Latest Price](https://www.amazon.com/Mpow-Bluetooth-Microphone-

The Mpow Pro Bluetooth Headset is designed with a noise-canceling feature that
blocks out unwanted noise to deliver a loud and clear voice through the
mouthpiece. It makes it seem like you are in a noise-free environment, even
when heavy winds are blowing past your face. The unit is lightweight, the
headband is flexible, and it features padded ear pads for enhanced comfort as
you drive.

  

This Mpow headset pairs easily with Bluetooth devices and has a connecting
range of up to 30 feet. It offers up to 200 hours of standby time and 12 hours
of talk time on a single charge. In addition, it only takes two hours to
acquire a full charge. The device delivers enhanced voice quality and is great
for truck drivers, video calls, call centers, and all Apple and Android
devices.

  

A major drawback of this car Bluetooth headphone is that it’s made of cheap-
quality products and may break easily. It may develop battery issues in less
than a year and offers less than six hours of talk time. Moreover, it’s slow
to connect when receiving a call, and you may miss a few calls if it’s not
turned on. It also can’t stream music.

The FOCUSPOWER Mini Bluetooth Earbud is a small and lightweight earbud that
fits comfortably in your left or right ear. It has a built-in microphone that
delivers loud and clear sound. The unit features Bluetooth 4.1 and EDR
technology with a connecting range of up to 33 feet. Multiple connection
technologies allow the device to connect to two mobile devices at the same
time.

  

This gadget runs on a high-quality lithium accumulator that can be charged
with a USB magnet charger. It has a long battery life and offers about six to
eight hours of talk time at 40 percent volume and 4.5 hours of battery life on
full volume. The device delivers a powerful sound, and you can use it for
listening to music, podcasts, audiobooks, and making hands-free phone calls.
It’s compatible with iPhone and Android smartphones.

  

A major drawback of this unit is that it’s not long-lasting. It may die after
only a year or develop some issues with its features. The battery may take

## Benefits of a Bluetooth Headset

  *  **Road safety.** A Bluetooth headset helps you avoid the distraction of using your phone or tuning your stereo while driving. You can focus on the road and take calls at the same time with the help of voice-assist technology. You can also get GPS directions when driving to unfamiliar destinations.
  *  **Entertainment.** Most Bluetooth headsets will allow you to listen to music from your phone, and the high-end versions will allow you to stream music. A good-quality wireless headset allows you to enjoy some entertainment options in your car without fiddling with the buttons on the stereo or your smartphone. 
  * **Wireless technology.** Most Bluetooth devices don’t have cords that can hinder or limit your movement while driving. That’s a big perk, since you don’t have to worry about adjusting the wire while you are driving or doing something else, such as jogging. 

## Types of Bluetooth Headsets

### Mono

A mono Bluetooth headset has one earpiece and a microphone. It’s best for
communication as opposed to entertainment. It typically delivers clear voice
quality and is lightweight and easy to use. The units have a small profile
that’s ideal for outdoor use. You can also use mono headsets to listen to
music, audiobooks, or podcasts if you don’t mind getting the sound on only one
ear.

### Stereo

A stereo Bluetooth headset comes with two earpieces with either an in-ear or
over-ear design. It may also come as a full-size headset with padded ear pads
and a protruding microphone. Stereo headsets are used for voice calls as well
as for entertainment. They deliver a well-balanced sound, since both earpieces
receive the same sound frequency.

## Tips

  * Do not completely enclose your ears while you’re driving. Most headsets have noise-canceling technology, and you may be blocked out from what’s happening around you. You should at least leave one ear open to maintain awareness of your surroundings.
  * Do not overcharge the headset. Ensure that you unhook it from the charging plug once the battery is full to avoid damaging the charging system or shortening the battery life. Follow the manufacturer’s recommendations on how long you should charge it.
  * Clean the headset regularly with a damp cloth to remove dust, ear wax, and dead skin cells. You can use a gentle disinfectant to remove microorganisms from the earbuds that can cause ear infections.
  * Always store the headset in a case when not in use. That helps to prevent dust and moisture from damaging the earpiece.
  * Disconnect the headset from your phone or any other device after use. Switch it off to preserve the battery life of the headset and the connected device. Also, don’t turn the volume too high when using the earpiece. You may damage the speakers.
  * The best operating range for a Bluetooth headset is about seven feet from the connected device. At that range, you will get the best sound quality with minimal interference from other Bluetooth devices.

## FAQs

### Q: Does a Bluetooth headset kill the phone’s battery?

 **A:** It depends on your phone’s battery life. Bluetooth headsets almost
never have a long-term effect on a phone’s battery. Most modern smartphones
can last for several hours with Bluetooth enabled. Answering and receiving
phone calls may not have a significant effect on battery life. However, you
may have a faster drop in charge if you stream music from your phone.

### Q: Will I get a good reception when using a Bluetooth headset outdoors?

 **A:** You will get a good reception as long as you are within the limits of
the gadget’s transmission range. However, you may experience some interference
in the reception if you are using a low-quality headset in public places. Some
interferences such as walls may also block the signal.

### Q: Can Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Connections interfere with each other?

 **A:** Typically, no. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi signals use different technologies
to transmit signals that cannot interfere with each other. Both Wi-Fi and
Bluetooth can be used simultaneously without resulting in any performance or
connection issues with your phone and headset. That’s why you can stream music
from your phone and get the best sound quality in your headset.
